Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: ionic
Description: The Ionic command-line interface (CLI) is the go-to tool for developing Ionic apps

Arguments.Name: build
Arguments.Description: Build web assets and prepare your app for any platform targets

Arguments.Name: --platform
Arguments.Description: Target platform on chosen engine (e.g. ios, android)

Arguments.Name: --prod
Arguments.Description: Flag to use the production configuration

Arguments.Name: completion
Arguments.Description: Enables tab-completion for Ionic CLI commands

Arguments.Name: --browser
Arguments.Description: Specifies the browser to use (safari, firefox, google chrome)

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Print project, system, and environment information

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Print system/environment info in JSON format

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Type of project (e.g. angular, react, vue, custom)

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Initialize even if a project already exists

Arguments.Name: --project-id
Arguments.Description: Specify a slug for your app

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: Mark the initialized app as the default project

Arguments.Name: repair
Arguments.Description: Remove and recreate dependencies and generated files

Arguments.Name: --cordova
Arguments.Description: Only perform the repair steps for Cordova platforms and plugins

Arguments.Name: serve
Arguments.Description: Start a local dev server for app dev/testing

Arguments.Name: --external
Arguments.Description: Host dev server on all network interfaces (i.e. --host=0.0.0.0)

Arguments.Name: --host
Arguments.Description: Use specific host for the dev server

Arguments.Name: --port
Arguments.Description: Use specific port for the dev server

Arguments.Name: --public-host
Arguments.Description: The host used for the browser or web view

Arguments.Name: --no-livereload
Arguments.Description: Do not spin up dev server--just serve files

Arguments.Name: --lab-host
Arguments.Description: Use specific host for Ionic Lab server

Arguments.Name: --lab-port
Arguments.Description: Use specific port for Ionic Lab server

Arguments.Name: --no-open
Arguments.Description: Do not open a browser window

Arguments.Name: --browser
Arguments.Description: Specifies the browser to use (safari, firefox, google chrome)

Arguments.Name: --browseroption
Arguments.Description: Specifies a path to open to (/#/tab/dash)

Arguments.Name: --lab
Arguments.Description: Test your apps on multiple platform types in the browser

Arguments.Name: --ssl
Arguments.Description: Use HTTPS for the dev server

Arguments.Name: --prod
Arguments.Description: Flag to use the production configuration

Arguments.Name: --consolelogs
Arguments.Description: Print app console logs to the terminal

Arguments.Name: --consolelogs-port
Arguments.Description: Use specific port for console logs server

Arguments.Description: Type of project to start (e.g. vue, angular, react, ionic-angular, ionic1)

Arguments.Name: --no-git
Arguments.Description: Do not initialize a git repo

Arguments.Description: Specify the bundle ID/application ID for your app (reverse-DNS notation)
